name: Hotel Giulio Cesare

reviews.text: Excellent service, friendly environment, nice location with good transportation and easy access to the centre.
reviews.title: A Very pleasant staying!!!!

reviews.text: The room was confortable, spacy, very clean, with good taste.
reviews.title: my choice when I'll be back in Rome

reviews.text: Clean rooms,a variety of toiletries, a relaxing garden, in a quite neighborhood, friendly staff that recommend to us one of the best trattorias in Italy with superb food and very affordable. The Metro is just minutes away and then in 1 stop we were at the Vatican or in 2-3 stops on the other way to Piazza di Spagna and Via Veneto. We were a group of 6 friends who had a great time and the hotel helped make our 3 day break unforgettable. We´ll be back.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location with helpful and courteous staff.

reviews.text: We (myself, husband, young daughter and parents in law) stayed at this hotel for three nights from 26-29 May for the Champions League Cup Final.
reviews.title: Very clean hotel

reviews.text: From arrival to departure the staff were polite, friendly and helpful. Nothing seemed like too much trouble.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We just got back 3/23/06 stayed 4 nights.The hotel is good,but the walls are paper thin.Our neighbors got up at 5 am every morning and we could hear everything from the shower to the blow dryer.And they are under construction so we heard banging at 6am 2 mornings. Also the hotel restaurant is closed in the off season,just open for breakfast.We were wanting for a table in the bar for 45 min and they turned away at least 25 people??
reviews.title: Not the best

reviews.text: very small room. incredibly small bathroom. stayed here during our honeymoon and were very dissapointed by all that. our room was so tine that there were no space at all even to walk around the bed. but there was a tiny balcony with the table - the only place where we didnt feel like trapped. the stuff was unfriendly. i guess i wont stay there again.
reviews.title: average
Excellent Hotel - Can't find fault
reviews.text: Very close to lepanto metro station (5 min walk max), great location - peaceful, but only 15 mins walk from spanish steps if you miss the last metro (and it's a safe, well lit route).

reviews.title: A great value and location
reviews.text: The hotel itself is lovely, very clean, very helpful and polite staff, amazing choice at breakfast (with homemade honey!).

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!!
reviews.text: I can't find fault with this hotel - will definitely stay again when we're next in rome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the most part, we were very happy with our stay at this hotel. We were upgraded from the older part of the hotel to the newer to start. The staff was very knowledgeable. Breakfast was awesome. The downsides were that you have to pay for internet, the A/C didn't work, and the location, while on a very quiet road, was a least a 5-10 minute walk to the nearest Metro.
reviews.title: Mostly good, some bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Giulio Cesare is a great hotel, especially if you like to stay in a neighbourhood which is peaceful rather than in amongst all the commotion a capital city has to offer. That said, it was not too far from anything - five minutes to the nearest tube station (Lepanto), and from there it was one stop to the Vatican, and only a few stops to the historic centre of Rome. If the tube is not your thing, it's a couple of minutes to the river and a thirty minute walk down quaint streets to the centre. Being away from the throng of tourists has another advantage - as well as being quiet, the eateries which were close to the hotel were more "Italian" - the ones we went to had a very local feel and were better quality and more reasonably priced than the central ones geared towards fleecing tourists.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in a peaceful yet convenient location

reviews.text: The hotel itself was very elegant inside. Thankfully air-conditioned, our room was small but adequate and well appointed and decorated. Classical in style but with a modern bathroom and amenities. The staff were all very friendly and spoke English, and the breakfast was good quality with plenty of choice and variety.
reviews.title: Great service, friendly staff and good location

reviews.text: If we return to Rome again I wouldn't hesitate in booking the hotel. The price is reasonable and we would rather stay there, a short way from the bustle, than smack bang in the middle of the city centre.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: One 'tip', and it's not a reflection on the hotel - when returning at night, walk along the main road from the tube station until you have to turn down to the hotel. The roads were a grid system so there are a number of chances to turn onto the road that the hotel is on. However, there didn't seem to be any street lights, and apart from some light from the houses that lined the street, it was very dark and the roads and pavements in Rome aren't always too even. The road from the tube is well lit, so you can avoid any pot holes.
reviews.title: Solid hotel at a great price

reviews.text: Stayed here for a long weekend when Wales played Italy earlier this month. The hotel accomodated a large mixed group of 15 of us and everyone would go back again due to the service we recieved and the overall experience of the hotel.
reviews.title: Good Service, Good Location, Good Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast spread catered for everyone and the piano bar provided a relaxing atmosphere to chill out in. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from the Piaza del Popolo so was ideal.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for a decent price

reviews.text: If i was to comment on anything negative it would be that there was some noise in the room, I was directly above the breakfast room which is the reason for this and don't think anyone else in the group had the same issue.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotet
Faded Glory
reviews.text: We stayed here for 10 days while on our honeymoon. The staff was very friendly and helpful even before we arrived. The hotel was very clean and nice. Room was a good size, we were going to be out mostly anyway. The only complaint I had was that the bed was firmer than I'm used to, but after a night or two I got used to it. There was a complimentary breakfast each morning that was good, had the basics. The location I tought was great. Only 2 blocks from the metro, a 10 minute walk to the Vatician, Olympic Statium about 20 min walk, Spanish Steps about 20 minutes and the Trevi Fountian isn't far from the Spanish Steps. We enjoyed being about to walk to most of the popular monuments, but if we were tired the metro wasn't far. I never felt unsafe walking around at anytime of the night either.

Just returned from a week in Rome and had wonderful accommodations at the Hotel Giulio Cesare. The rooms were fairly spacious with large closets. Our bathroom was a bit small with just a shower, but other rooms had tub/shower combos. The towels were large and fluffy{with towel warmers} and the toiletries were fine and plentiful. Rooms were serviced in a timely fashion every day. The staff was very cordial. There was a lovely buffet breakfast every morning with eggs and other hot dishes, as well as cereal and delicious baked goods. There were a couple rooms off the lobby to chat and relax. The location of the hotel was excellent. It was a couple short blocks from a metro stop. It was within walking distance of nice local shops and restaurants and you could also walk across one of the bridges on the Tiber and be at the Piazza del Poppolo in 10 minutes. We walked to the Pantheon and the Vatican easily. There was a small bar at the hotel, but a little cafe would have been nice for an afternoon tea or coffee. It was definitely off-season, so perhaps they have more restaurant services in the prime tourist season. I would definitely stay there again--very comfortable.
reviews.title: Very Average Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived very very late (3:00 am) we ask for a room and they was very gentle helping us. the room was medium small size on the 5 floor - last one. Clean and with nice furniture. Parking is a little small - so if u have a big car can be hard to move it - but was included in our room rate. Wonderful breakfast!!!!!
reviews.title: very good

reviews.text: Had one day in Rome before a conference and asked for a recommendation from local colleagues. This hotel was fabulous. Low-key, very professional service. Quiet neighborhood very close to The Vatican. Gracious and copious breakfast. Very comfortable, large, well-appointed room. It was a perfect pick for a business traveler with only one day to be a tourist. It was perfect for frequent travelers who prefer a "real" neighborhood.
reviews.title: Perfectly lovely neighborhood hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is in an excellent position, close to Lepanto Metro and bus routes, but is also within walking distance to the Vatican and historic centre of Rome. There are many good restaurants nearby (booking recommended in high season). The hotel provides an excellent breakfast buffet, with plenty of choice to suit most tastes and the dining room was specially opened for us one day at 06.45, as we had to leave early on a tour of the Vatican. Our 'superior'-classified room was very well appointed with comfortable beds, a well-equipped bathroom and spotlessly clean. From the terrace on 5th floor, there is a fantastic view to be had over Rome and St Peter's Basilica. We will definitely return for another visit and stay here.
reviews.title: Six wonderful days in Rome in a lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Top notch service is what we received during our stay at Hotel Giulio Cesare. As our stay was focused on relaxing and visiting the St. Peter's this was a perfect location. It is a bit of a walk to historic center but not terrible. I'm struck by how the shopping in the neighborhood has changed (for the better) in the last 8 years - it's an interesting section of the city. The rooms at the hotel are extremely clean and the food is quite good. The breakfast service is top notch. There is a lovely garden out back. Staff was terrific.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After searching through so many options in Rome, we are so glad that we chose this wonderful hotel in the Prati district! Hello to everyone there, especially Manuel and Giovanni! Couldn't have asked for a more delightful stay in Rome and a peaceful place to come to at the end of our site seeing. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was delicious and having the Metro stop two blocks away was perfect. Perfect for folks who do not want to "stay" in the hustle bustle of the tourist district, as the area is residential and quiet at night, though "the" best restaurant in Rome is not far away - Perilli in Prati. Thanks again to Hotel Giulio Cesare for such a wonderful start to our Italian honeymoon, we are recommending to all of our friends and will be back.
reviews.title: Great location, Friendly Staff, perfect retreat after touring sites!

description: The Hotel Giulio Cesare is the dream of every tourist: located in a quiet, pleasant street and yet within walking distance from St. Peter's Basilica, the Vatican Museum, Piazza del Popolo and the Spanish Steps, as well as all the fashionable shopping areas, like via Condotti.The building was once a patrician villa. While preserving the flavour and charm of the old times, all its facilities are designed to meet the needs of the most demanding guests.
